title: Understanding Cards
text: A standard deck of playing cards has $$52$$ cards, divided into $$4$$ suits: hearts, diamonds, clubs, and spades. Each suit contains $$13$$ cards. You need to count how many cards are either a red ace or a club.

title: Number of Red Aces
text: The red aces are the ace of hearts and the ace of diamonds. So, there are $$2$$ red aces in total.

title: Number of Clubs
text: The clubs are all the cards in the suit of clubs, so there are $$13$$ clubs

title: Addition Principle
text: Since we are selecting either a red ace or a club, we should use the Addition Principle. The events are mutually exclusive (a card cannot be both a red ace and a club), so we can simply add the number of red aces and the number of clubs.
